pullRequest.body:
Feat: Add `Similiarty` in `Topology.MetricSpace.Similarity`

This is a port of a mathlib branch:

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18214

See #7478 for more context.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [eab2b738da](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7479/commits/eab2b738daffeebea4de0bc59ec683d3a711ae7f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Similarity` (new file)|895|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Congruent.similarity`
`+ Similarity`
`+ _root_.similarity_comm`
`+ exists_dist_eq`
`+ exists_edist_eq`
`+ exists_nndist_eq`
`+ index_equiv`
`+ index_map`
`+ of_exists_dist_eq`
`+ of_exists_edist_eq`
`+ of_exists_nndist_eq`
`+ of_pairwise_exists_dist_eq`
`+ of_pairwise_exists_edist_eq`
`+ of_pairwise_exists_nndist_eq`
`+ refl`
`+ similarity_iff_exists_dist_eq`
`+ similarity_iff_exists_edist_eq`
`+ similarity_iff_exists_nndist_eq`
`+ symm`
`+ trans`
`++++++ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This one is a predicate on two indexed families of points, `Dilation` is a map on PseudoEMetricSpaces such that this predicate holds for all families of points. The converse - that this predicate on two indexed families can be extended to a `Dilation` from the first space to the second that maps the first indexed family to the second - is a theorem that holds under appropriate conditions in Euclidean spaces (as discussed on Zulip, existing lemmas about distances and inner products for affine combinations should provide most of what's needed to prove that theorem), but not in more general metric space context.

On the whole I think we should probably get #7478 sorted out before this one, though I don't think there's any actual dependency between them.

Note that the mathlib3 PRs also include various Euclidean results about congruence and similarity for angles and triangles, that haven't been ported to Lean 4 as far as I know (but of course the basic metric space content should be dealt with first).
I don't have the time right now (maybe in the future??) to work on these PRs (this one and #7478).  If the changes they introduce are needed, feel free to take them over.

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/MetricSpace/Similarity): define Similarity
